similaranime.anime: Nejimaki Seirei Senki: Tenkyou no Alderamin

recommendations.recommendation: It gives somewhat of a feeling of "Legend of Galactic Heroes meets Outlaw Star", although it does not bring in any of the good aspects of either series. The whole series feels like a very long introduction to a plot that never comes. It can be entertaining if you are a fan of the genre.
Space Opera with great character designs, music, and of course a captivating story line.
If u like something with a streamlined story and plot continuity, then watch this.
It would be a must see if there weren`t Heldensagen vom Kosmosinsel ;)

So much potential, but in the end I just didn`t like the MC at all for a story like this he had to show more development, Fan Hyulick...one of the most disappointing characters of all time for me.
Still the animation is good some of the other characters are notable shame they didn`t give it a proper ending there is no way an OVA or 2nd series will be made.

anime.description: * Based on a novel by award-winning novelist http://anidb.net/cr991 [Tanaka Yoshiki]. In a future where mankind is scattered across the stars, the Empire of Valdana is under the control of the Tytania family, who forged its influence through intimidation and economic might. In the year 446, Tytania dispatches a large fleet to seize a new piece of technology from the city-state Euriya. Much to everyone`s surprise, Euriya decides to resist and wins. Their isolated act of rebellion sets into motion a sequence of events that strains the careful alliances and treaties within the empire, as various factions seek to exploit the situation to their own advantage. In the ensuing turmoil, ambitious members of the Tytania royalty begin moving against each other in an effort to settle old grievances and seize control of the family. What started as an act of rebellion by Euriya quickly expands into a civil war - with the wealth and power of the empire up for grabs to whoever is bold enough to seize it.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: aristocrat
tag.description: An aristocrat or noble is a member of the aristocracy or nobility, an upper class in feudal societies. Nobles may or may not hold any specific nobility title. For simplicity`s sake, royalty should also be considered nobility.

tag.name: carefree
tag.description: A [b]carefree[b] person is free of worries, cares or concerns. This does not necessarily imply that they have no responsibilities or are negligent towards them; they are simply able to live out their lives in tranquility regardless of what happens.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tytania Kikan Golden Sheep
character.description: Flagship of Aryabhata Tytania

character.name: Aryabhata Tytania
character.description: Ariabart Tytania is one of the four dukes in line to succeed Ajman Tytania as the head of the Tytania Clan. Early on, Ariabart underestimates the Eurian Fleet at the battle of Cereberus and is forced to retreat by Fan Hyulick. His retreat earns him the ignominious honor of being the first Tytania to suffer defeat in battle in 200 years. It is shown that of the four dukes, Ariabart mainly prefers the company of Jouslain and has great respect for his abilities. Ariabart flagship name is call the Golden Sheep.

character.name: Ajman Tytania
character.description: The "Landless Lord" Ajman Tytania is the current head of the Tytania clan.

character.name: Zarlisch Tytania
character.description: Zarlisch Tytania is one of the four dukes in line to succeed Ajman Tytania as the head of the Tytania Clan. Zarlish distinguishes himself mainly by his military accomplishments. Zarlisch is the elder brother of Alses Tytania. Zarlish flagship name is call the Typhoon.

character.name: Jouslain Tytania
character.description: Jouslain Tytania is one of the four dukes in line to succeed Ajman Tytania as the clan`s next Landless Lord. He is seen by some as the favored out of the four dukes to succeed Ajman. Jouslain prefers to resolve disputes using diplomacy over military force or scheming. Jouslain flagship is called the Austra.

character.name: Salomon
character.description: Chancellor of the empire Salomon

character.name: Fan Hyulick
character.description: Fan Hyulick is a former Admiral of Euria. At the Battle of Cereberus, Fan Hyulick forces Lord Aryabhata to retreat. Inflicting the first loss the Tytania clan has suffered in 200 years. Fan Hyulick was selected by the Mayor of Euria to lead the Eurian Fleet at the Battle fo Cereberus with the intention of losing the battle. Fan`s unexpected victory forces the mayor to exile Hyulick to appease the Tytania clan. Fan Hyulick currently resides aboard the Honest Old Man, a smuggler ship captained by Mirada Casimir traveling across the universe while attempting to evade the grasp of the Tytania Clan.

character.name: Idris Tytania
character.description: Idris Tytania is the youngest of the four Dukes in line for succeeding as the head of the clan. Under orders from Ajman he assassinates the Secretary of the Emperor, to initiate Tytania`s supremacy. Idris will use any means to resolve a conflict and succeed as the head of the Tytania clan, even if it means putting the other dukes in trouble. Idris flagship name is called the Fire Phoenix.

character.name: Neville Tytania
character.description: The first landless clanlord and founder of the tytania clan, Neville.

character.name: Nouri Tytania
character.description: Second landless clanlord.

character.name: Francia
character.description: Francia is part of Jouslain Tytania`s household.

character.name: Oppenordt
character.description: Lord Ajman Tytania`s butler

character.name: Lira Florenz
character.description: Lira Florenz is part of the resistance force on Emmental seeking to restore the Principality of Casabianca. Florenz meets Hyulick after his exile from Euria.

character.name: Alses Tytania
character.description: Zarlish Tytania`s brother and count of a small planet.

character.name: Uba
character.description: Servant of Ajman Tytania.

character.name: Florimonde Debohr
character.description: Rebel in the same group as Lira Florenz

character.name: Bal`Ami Tytania
character.description: Bal`Ami, the son of marquis Estrada Tytania, brother to Ajman Tytania. He serves under Duke Jouslain Tytania and is caretaker of Lydia.

character.name: Compton Casimir
character.description: Captain fo the Honest Old Man and married to Miranda Casimir; He`s mute after tytanian soldiers cut out his tongue.

character.name: Connaught
character.description: Major General of the Tyrandia Army.

character.name: Erwin Reiser
character.description: Friend of Laetitia Tyrandia, serves in the Tyrandian army

character.name: Estradas Tytania
character.description: Brother of Ajman Tytania, he is reluctant that his younger brother was named Clanlord instead of him. He is the minister of war. His son is Bal`Ami Tytania.

character.name: Hafez
character.description: Major General Hafez of the Tyrandia Army.

character.name: Laetitia Tyrandia
character.description: Laetitia Tyrandie, daughter of the Grand Duke of Tyrandia and ruler of Tyrandia after his death.

character.name: Lydia
character.description: Lydia is the second princess of the Elbing Kingdom. She currently resides on Uraniborg under the custody of Jouslain Tytania. Her primary recreation is gardening. Lydia volunteered to use herself as a hostage to appease the Landless Lord`s test of Elbing Kingdom`s loyalty and to save her country`s mine, it`s only source of income. She is 10 years old.

character.name: Miranda Casimir
character.description: Married to Compton Casimir she`s second in command on the Honost Old Man. She seeks revenge on Tytania for what they did to her husband.

character.name: Obaa-chan
character.description: Lira Florenz`s grandmother.

character.name: Salaam Amzekahl
character.description: Imperial Army Admiral of Vardhana.

character.name: Theresa Tytania
character.description: Mother of Zarlish and Alses Tytania.

character.name: Tyrandia
character.description: Deceased grand duke of Tyrandia. Father of Laetitia Tyrandia.

character.name: Alan Mahdi
character.description: A former Tytania soldier dragged into the rebellion by Fan Hyulick and his comrades

character.name: Honest Old Man
character.description: The ship of Compton Casimir and Miranda Casimir.

character.name: Nunez
character.description: Vardhana Imperial Minister of Civil Affairs.

character.name: Zugden
character.description: Vardhana Imperial Minister of Home Affairs.

character.name: Hellauer
character.description: Vardhana Imperial Ministerof Justice.

character.name: Waiz
character.description: Luitenant-Colonel in the Vardhana Army

character.name: Doorman
character.description: Leader of the Blaze Flag Army

character.name: Zhang-Chen Lee
character.description: Dr Lee, a philosopher with a personality problem and a peculiar interest in Hyulick.

character.name: Kokuou
character.description: King of Elbing and father of Lydia

character.name: Flagship Typhoon
character.description: The Typhoon, the flaagship of Zarlish Tytania

character.name: Henrik
character.description: A former Vardhana Major-General now involved with the Blaze Flag Army

character.name: Lancaster
character.description: Lieutenant-General under Zarlish Tytania.

character.name: Mackensen
character.description: Lieutenant General, now involved with the Blaze Flag Army

character.name: Toscani
character.description: Former Major-General now involved with the Blaze Flag Army.

character.name: Flagship Austra
character.description: the flagship of Jouslain Tytania.

character.name: Dick Furman
character.description: An imprisoned rebel at the Esterl prison.

character.name: Berthier
character.description: Colonel under Idris Tytania. He holds a grudge against Fan Hyulick after he was defeated by him.

character.name: Kyle
character.description: Captain at a remote base of Tytania. He is responsible for the torture of Compton Casimir.

character.name: Catherine
character.description: Distant Family of Kallen.

character.name: Valenti
character.description: Commander of a remote base of Tytania. He runs the area like a mob boss.

character.name: Dr. White
character.description: A doctor taken hostage by Hyulicks comrades who is then impersonated by Al Mahdi.

character.name: Flagship Firebird
character.description: The flagship of Idris Tytania

character.name: Bob Furman
character.description: An imprisoned rebel at the Esterl prison.

character.name: Ibn Kashim
character.description: Leader of an underground rebel group.

character.name: Irku
character.description: Lieutenant Commander in the Valgashu army.

character.name: Louis Edmond Pages
character.description: A soldier and friend of Fan Hyulick now in Hyulicks rebel group.

character.name: Tourville
character.description: Major general of the Valgashu Army.

character.name: Sonia
character.description: Leader of a rebel group.

character.name: Michael Valenkov
character.description: Former soldier and friend of Hyulick now in his rebel group.

character.name: Albert Kannack
character.description: President of Esterl.

character.name: Theodore Tytania
character.description: One of the 4 Grand Dukes (Deceased) and father of Idris Tytania.

character.name: Thomas
character.description: Uncle of Kallen.

episode.title: 天の城(ウラニボルグ)の四公爵
The Four Princes of Uranibolg (Castle in Heaven)
Ten no Shiro (Uraniborg) no Yon Koushaku
流星の旗のもとに
Under the Flag of the Shooting Star
Ryuusei no Hata no Moto ni
一粒の麦のごとく
Like a Grain of Wheat
Hitotsu Bu no Mugi no Gotoku
オネストオールドマン
Honest Old Man
Honest Old Man
終幕の鎮魂歌(レクイエム)
Final Act: Requiem
Shuumaku no Sankon Uta (Requiem)
